text:
hey all, helping a co (saas for content marketers) bring a content writer onboard for a) internal content work + b) guest posting (pitching & writing)

*this is my first rodeo, so i’d love advice on:* 
• what budget should we set aside? (ballpark helps)
• how does pricing work? (is per article better or a FT contract?) 
• what’s the best place to find + hire them?
lastly, anything you wish you knew before you hired your first writer? tia folks!

elements.text: hey all, helping a co (saas for content marketers) bring a content writer onboard for a) internal content work + b) guest posting (pitching & writing)
this is my first rodeo, so i’d love advice on:
what budget should we set aside? (ballpark helps)
how does pricing work? (is per article better or a FT contract?)
what’s the best place to find + hire them?
lastly, anything you wish you knew before you hired your first writer? tia folks!

text:
All these questions have a lot of dependencies.

I think the biggest is what's your niche/industry?

This will help you decide whether you can hire a generalist writer or specialist in one area.

elements.text:

text:
I'm looking for a web designer to design a WordPress site from scratch. Ideally, they're a freelancer with a portfolio I can check out. Does anyone have any solid recommendations?
Note: _I'm not looking for someone "who thinks they can help" - I want someone who does this for a living_ :slightly_smiling_face:

I'm not looking for someone "who thinks they can help" - I want someone who does this for a living

text:
I'm seeing that most successful content marketing is from SaaS products. Databox, Mio, Help Scout, Buffer, etc - most of these are SaaS products.

Do you think content marketing can really drive customer acquisition for other industries?

elements.text:
I'm seeing that most successful content marketing is from SaaS products. Databox, Mio, Help Scout, Buffer, etc - most of these are SaaS products.

Do you think content marketing can really drive customer acquisition for other industries?

text: Short answer--yes. Long answer--qualified yes. Acquisition is not the only benchmark for content marketing success. In other industries, customer retention and using content to convert customers into advocates is a measure of success. The travel industry is a good example as people tend to have preferred hotels and airlines they constantly book with. Marriott and Southwest, for example are very strong in content marketing. I bet most of their customers are repeat customers.

elements.text: Short answer--yes. Long answer--qualified yes. Acquisition is not the only benchmark for content marketing success. In other industries, customer retention and using content to convert customers into advocates is a measure of success. The travel industry is a good example as people tend to have preferred hotels and airlines they constantly book with. Marriott and Southwest, for example are very strong in content marketing. I bet most of their customers are repeat customers.

text: Hello Dominick - Would you be open to a small agency? I have a web vendor whom I've worked with at my current job on design updates and new pages (they also manage our site, host, and do SEO) and though they've only updated our current design I know building a new site is in their wheelhouse and I would recommend them. If you are interested in connecting with them, let me know!

text: I had written an article for the sole purpose of building backlinks. It was a listicle and added 20+ tools just to get links to our website. Turned out its a common strategy. But yeah it helped. :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Hello, if you only have a few hours a month free to consult for the client, but it is of high value to him. How do you set up a collaboration model and what is your experiences? Especially when it comes to strategic consulting.

elements.text: Hello, if you only have a few hours a month free to consult for the client, but it is of high value to him. How do you set up a collaboration model and what is your experiences? Especially when it comes to strategic consulting.

text:
I do this for one client. We've turned it into coaching rather than consultancy.

So everything gets recorded so they can review again later. And the goal of our calls is for me to educate their team how to do the things they ideally wanted me to do.

elements.text:

text: Anyone have experience connecting Google Analytics and Salesforce data without using Google Analytics 360 (the $$$ SF product). I would like to be able to pass Google Analytics channel data through to Salesforce leads and contacts to get a better sense of where conversions are coming from. We have goal tracking for leads and purchase conversions turned on in GA, I'd just like to see that channel data reflected in SF as well since it's really our source of truth when it comes to actual numbers of leads and contacts. Thank you!

text:
I blog once a week (most weeks) and have a weekly podcast. Not actively growing either one right now; focusing more on thought leadership via LinkedIn and Clubhouse.

I am, however, just starting to convert podcast episodes into audiogram "videos" for YouTube to see how that works. Anyone tried that?
